main event: On 19 July 1949, at 2155Z, a photographer in Columbus, Ohio reported sighting an unidentified flying object resembling a flying wing type aircraft with luminous color, very fast speed, and a humming noise. The object was observed flying straight at an altitude of 3000 to 4000 feet and heading due East.
interesting points: The witness was a photographer with experience working with jet aircraft and engines.
No photographs or sketches of the observed object were provided.
The object was described as similar to present-day jet aircraft but too small for a one-man aircraft.
It emitted a humming noise instead of a rushing noise and had no noticeable exhaust.
The report was downgraded to unclassified when separated from classified enclosures.
sighted object: unidentified flying object resembling a flying wing type aircraft
witnesses: photographer with experience working with jet aircraft and engines
